# Neuroanatomy III

## Spinal cord

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Rostral/Caudal axis
    - Spinal column w/ vertebrae
    - Cervical (8), thoracic (12), lumbar (5), sacral (5), coccygeal (1)
    - Spinal segments & 31 nerve pairs 
    - Cauda equina
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](http://www.fauxpress.com/kimball/med/sensory/spinaldivisions.jpg){width="50%"}
:::
::::

:::: {.columns}

## Spinal cord

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Dorsal/Ventral
  + Dorsal root (sensory)
  + Ventral root (mostly motor)
- Grey (interior) vs. white matter (exterior)
:::

## Organization of the PNS  

- Somatic division
    - Voluntary sensory & motor function
- Autonomic division
    - Involuntary sensory & motor function
- Cranial nerves
- Spinal nerves

## Cranial nerves

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Sensory & motor functions of the cranium (head) and neck
- Afferents (input/sensory), efferents (output/motor), or mixed/both
  - On Old Olympus' Towering Top...
  - Some Say Marry Money...
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![Encyclopedia Britannica](https://cdn.britannica.com/44/54244-004-892C5169/nerves-pairs-muscles-region-head-sense-organs.jpg)
:::
::::

## Cranial nerves

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Innervate head and neck
- Olfactory (I), optic (II), (VIII) auditory,
vagus (X), etc. 
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![Encyclopedia Britannica](https://cdn.britannica.com/44/54244-004-892C5169/nerves-pairs-muscles-region-head-sense-organs.jpg)
:::
::::

## Autonomic nervous system (ANS) 

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- CNS & PNS components
- Controls "vegetative functions""
    + Limited voluntary control
- Two divisions
    + Sympathetic
    + Parasympathetic
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](http://humanphysiology.academy/Neurosciences%202015/Images/2/NEU_autonomic_nervous_system%20Merck%20Manuals.gif){width="80%"}
:::
::::

## Sympathetic division 

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Prepares body for action
- "Fight or flight"
- Spinal cord
    + ganglion chain along spinal column to end organs
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](http://humanphysiology.academy/Neurosciences%202015/Images/2/NEU_autonomic_nervous_system%20Merck%20Manuals.gif){width="80%" fig-align="right"}
:::
::::

## Sympathetic division

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Neurotransmitters
    + Preganglionic: Acetylcholine (ACh) 
    + Post: Norepinephrine (NE)
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](http://humanphysiology.academy/Neurosciences%202015/Images/2/NEU_autonomic_nervous_system%20Merck%20Manuals.gif){width="80%" fig-align="right"}
:::
::::

## Parasympathetic division 

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Para -> "around"
- Restorative function
- "Rest & digest"
- Spinal cord -> ganglia near end organs -> end organ
    + Neurotransmitter: Acetylcholine (ACh)
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](http://humanphysiology.academy/Neurosciences%202015/Images/2/NEU_autonomic_nervous_system%20Merck%20Manuals.gif){width="80%" fig-align="right"}
:::
::::
